title: OneWeb to launch second-generation satellites with Relativity Space
summary: OneWeb will launch some of its next-generation satellites on Relativity Space’s next-generation launch vehicle starting as soon as 2025, the companies announced June 30.

title: Rocket Report: ULA starts military lobbying campaign, SLS to launch in 2 months
summary: "I don't think we're stretching ourselves to get there."

title: Venus orbiter, lunar constellation and exoplanets telescopes among candidates as China selects new space science missions
summary: The Chinese Academy Sciences is preparing to select a new batch of space missions from proposals to study Earth, the Sun and solar system, and the deeper universe as part of a "New Horizons Program."

title: SpaceX Cargo Dragon launch slips to mid-July
summary: NASA and SpaceX have decided to delay the company’s next Cargo Dragon launch a third time after discovering a small propellant leak...

title: NASA Awards Engineering, Technology, Science Contract
summary: NASA has awarded the JSC Engineering, Technology, and Science (JETS) II contract to Jacobs Technology Inc. of Tullahoma, Tennessee, to provide engineering and scientific products, technical services and related services for the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston, other NASA centers and government agencies.

title: Florida Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: Florida students will have an opportunity soon to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Atlas V launch with two experimental military satellites delayed due to weather
summary: United Launch Alliance will now deploy a pair of Space Force technology demonstration payloads using its Atlas V rocket no earlier than Friday. The USSF-12 mission was due to liftoff from Cape Canaveral on Thursday, but persisting lightning storms in the area prevented a launch attempt throughout the entirety of a two-hour window.

title: China looks to launch liquid propellant rockets from the seas
summary: Chinese state-owned and commercial companies are developing capabilities to launch liquid propellant rockets from sea platforms to boost the country's launch options.

title: SpaceX wins FCC approval to connect Starlink satellites to moving vehicles
summary: Eleven months after SpaceX submitted several applications, the FCC has given the company permission to connect moving vehicles to its constellation of...

title: House appropriators reduce proposed budget for FAA commercial space office
summary: House appropriators eliminated most of a proposed budget increase for the FAA’s commercial space transportation office while also directing the agency on spaceports and cooperation with another agency on spaceflight investigations.
